ðŸŒŸ Termix | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Centralized web-based server management, providing SSH terminal, tunneling, and file editing functionalities.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ SSH Terminal Access with split-screen and tab support â€¢ SSH Tunnel Management with automatic reconnection and health monitoring â€¢ Remote File Editor with syntax highlighting and file management â€¢ SSH Host Manager for saving and organizing SSH connections â€¢ Server Stats for viewing CPU, memory, and HDD usage
ðŸ“– Summary: Termix is a web-based server management platform written in TypeScript. It provides SSH terminal access, SSH tunneling, and remote file editing capabilities through a web interface, aiming to be a self-hosted, all-in-one server management solution.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ ascii-converter | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Converting multimedia files and webcam streams into ASCII art for display in the terminal or saving as files.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Image to ASCII conversion â€¢ GIF to ASCII conversion â€¢ Video to ASCII conversion â€¢ Audio to ASCII conversion â€¢ Webcam to ASCII conversion
ðŸ“– Summary: The ASCII Converter is a command-line tool written in Go that converts images, GIFs, audio, videos, and webcam streams into ASCII art. It supports various input formats and allows users to preview the ASCII art in the terminal or save it to files.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ activepieces | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: AI workflow automation and integration of various services using a no-code or low-code approach, particularly for AI agents and MCPs.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Open Source and Extensible â€¢ Type-Safe Pieces Framework (TypeScript) â€¢ MCP Server Functionality for AI Agents
ðŸ“– Summary: Activepieces is an open-source, TypeScript-based AI automation platform positioned as a Zapier alternative. It emphasizes extensibility through a type-safe framework, allowing users to create and share integrations (pieces) that can be used as MCP servers for AI agents. The platform offers a no-code builder, AI SDK, and enterprise-ready features, focusing on security and human-in-the-loop capabilities.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ oh-my-logo | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating visually appealing ASCII art logos for terminal display and project branding.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Two Rendering Modes (outlined or filled) â€¢ 13 Beautiful Palettes â€¢ Vertical, horizontal, and diagonal gradients â€¢ Multi-line Support â€¢ Zero Dependencies (npx usage)
ðŸ“– Summary: oh-my-logo is a TypeScript-based tool for generating visually appealing ASCII art logos with gradient colors in the terminal. It offers features like different rendering modes, customizable palettes, and multi-line support, making it suitable for project banners, startup logos, or terminal customization.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ fireplexity | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: AI-driven search engine for web, news, and images with real-time data and citations.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI-powered search â€¢ Real-time citations â€¢ Streaming responses â€¢ Live data integration â€¢ Web search
ðŸ“– Summary: Fireplexity v2 is an AI search engine that provides real-time citations, streaming responses, and live data. It supports searching across web, news, and images, offering a comprehensive search experience powered by Firecrawl.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ lazyeat | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Contactless control of devices during activities like eating, where users want to avoid touching devices with dirty hands.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Hands-free convenience â€¢ Intuitive gesture control â€¢ Multi-platform support (Windows, MacOS, Linux) â€¢ Voice input integration
ðŸ“– Summary: Lazyeat is a hands-free control tool that uses gesture recognition and voice input to allow users to interact with their devices without touching them. It's designed for situations where users have dirty or greasy hands, such as while eating, enabling them to pause videos, adjust volume, and navigate content through gestures and voice commands.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ pinstr | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Curating and sharing interests with others in a decentralized social network.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Decentralized backend with Nostr protocol â€¢ Open-source and free to use â€¢ Create customized public boards of pins on almost any topic â€¢ Like, Comment, and Zap other users' boards â€¢ Easy-to-use interface
ðŸ“– Summary: Pinstr is a decentralized social network built on the Nostr protocol, enabling users to curate and share their interests through customizable boards. It offers features like creating public boards, liking/commenting on other users' content, and attaching Nostr profiles and notes to boards, all while being open-source and free to use.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
